scraped_reviews.content: Just when you thought it couldn't get worse they changed from hearts to an arbitrary "charges" that go down no matter what you do or how you perform. Run out in the middle of a lesson? Too bad! Audio to text interpretation remains terrible. Audio quality in sentences remains spotty. Phrases are still repeated in the same lesson. I've learned enough of my language to realize some of their phrases and verb usage is wrong too. Google translate agrees.

I like the app overall, but the new energy system is weak. you run out of energy even while being correct. I can't study as much as I could with the heart system. and now the whiteout survival ad doesn't have any way to close it at all, you have to quit the app and reopen it. destroying the app like crazy this month. dropping my rating to 2 stars. now another ad can't close no matter what. I guess I can't rate any lower than 1 star. my next step is uninstall and try airlearn.

Gets worse and worse, saying this is free is false advertising. I have been with the app for 5+ years, and now the "charges" instead of hearts are terrible. Doesn't matter if you make no mistakes you still have to watch ads or you will run out of "charges". You used to be able to just practice for hearts. Then it was ads, for hearts. Now it's these "charges" that run out after 1 lesson if you don't watch adds. Will be looking into other free language apps now. Been going downhill for awhile.

The new energy system makes the free membership pretty much impossible to use. Even if you're perfect, you can only get about 3 lessons done. I went from being able to do 6-8 lessons to barely 3. This ruins the app's purpose to teach languages unless you can afford the paid version, which completely goes against the app's original purpose. It's clear that the company has shifted their focus from teaching language to doing whatever they have to to make money, even when it ruins their app.

I have rolled with all the changes in this app for three years. I dislike that I get "docked" energy points for giving correct answers. The "extra credit" I receive when I make five correct answers in a row are just not enough. I've completed a lesson a few times while on my last energy and lost progress. It's a real downer when you were counting on that for your badge before midnight.

I have a 1,364-day streak. I just got switched from the heart to the energy system and it's awful: I can't even complete one "legendary" lesson without running out of energy, usually at the very last question (of course). Obviously a ploy to force learners to subscribe to the paid app. Every recent change has been for the worse (repetitive lessons, no explanations for mistakes, etc.). I was reluctant to let my streak go, but this does it.

It has an amazing amount of languages to choose from. This is a good app to learn foreign languages by total immersion. I wish it would teach me the rules of the language instead of having me figure it out myself. EDIT: The new "energy" system is simply a new way to pressure you into clicking ads, it takes away all the fun of using the app and it's unfair to basically act as ransomware by stopping your nearly complete perfect lesson and forcing you to either lose your progress or watch ads. ü´©

For a while there have been bugs in the app that the 'daily refresh' of the music lessons would not be matched up with the songs actual names. Another bug is that sometimes you would get a reward but it wouldn't actually show up and you didn't actually get it. Another thing that bothers me is the Duolingo ad that has someone sitting in the restroom, and a few other ads. They don't seem appropriate, as children use this app too. Otherwise besides these things the app teaches lessons pretty well.

I was always on the fence if I wanted to keep doing this game. While I was learning words and general sentence structure, I never felt confident actually speaking Spanish. now they changed the game. before you lost hearts if you get an answer wrong. now instead of hearts,energy which can be lost just for answering a question, you can run out of energy mid game even when answering correctly, causing you to pay in jewels to keep playing or exit out. this seems like a good time to find another app.

The app has become worse as they rely on AI more, while at the same time reducing functionality for the free plans. It used to be I could find out WHY an error was wrong in app, but those days are long past, making it almost impossible to actually learn anything as opposed to just memorizing the response they want. Add in the fact that the xp boost gifts no longer work, but the friends quests are largely xp based, and this feels less and less like some I want to bother spending my time on.

So I have been a max user for about a year now. Paid version is Good for getting rid of all the annoying barriers, but not much else. The AI is really bad. not worth the upgrade. no way to rate the conversations. I can only talk about whether I like tea or coffee so many times. If you try and steer the conversation the the AI just breaks. Also, if the service goes down and you lose an xp boost, you aint getting that back, even if it cost gems. They got the gamification down though!

I have a 1280 streak and have always given this app 5 stars. The new energy system is the worst. To get multiple perfect lessons and still be forced to spend hard earned gems or watch even more ads is ridiculous. Especially when the ads constantly get stuck in a repeating loop and has to be shut down. The app used to be fair, paid plan or not, which I won't now that I am basically being forced to. Ready to quit and find something that's not trying to put a cap on learning in favor of money.

I have been using Duolingo for ~7 years. I have noticed recently that lessons have felt strange. I don't know how to explain it but over the last 5 to 6 months mostly, maybe? The structure has been different, more difficult to follow, originally I thought this was maybe that the team was just going a little bit nuts w memeification. But also their bullying feature in the feed was a terrible choice. I'll be quitting, and switching to smth else when my sub runs out or before if it keeps going

first off I'm on a 392 day streak so I've used it for a bit. two huge, major, gigantic problems. 1) in Japanese when you have to type out a word sometimes completely randomly it will tell you you're wrong. 2) requiring you to spend $30 so it can explain your mistakes is an absolute joke. how are you supposed to learn a language when it refuses to tell you why you mess up. it's not a good app and I will be looking for a replacement ASAP. 2/5

I don't really feel like using the app anymore with the new "energy" update. Before, you could continue to play for free so long as you didn't make mistakes. Now, answering any question at all drains your energy bar, and the energy is completely drained after only a lesson or two. I cannot even begin to explain how much this destroys the quality of using Duolingo

The app was useful and fun to use for learning. I dropped my rating down to 1 star because they changed how the teaching is accessed. It used to be that you had hearts and lost one for every wrong answer, but now they have an energy system, where every question costs energy. It is obviously a ploy to force people to buy their premium packages, which is going to make a lot of free users, like me, go and find a better app. I do not recommend this app.

I like this app. But I don't like it that it will lag big time when you are trying to do your music lessons on earbuds and it will stall and freeze, so it makes you miss XPs or the keys that you are trying to hit in time. Now, it seems to do OK without having the earbuds on. But on days that I want to use my earbuds, I hate to because it gives me problems, and I hate that. Other than that, I love the app and highly suggest it for learning math, music, or a language, and actually chess too!

The best language app there is and has been for a while, they set the pace that the other language apps are just trying to follow, but they've been here just getting better at it for years. You get extra follow-up questions right after your mistakes now, both the free and paid versions have value in themselves, my only complaint is the curriculum is more focused on traveling necessities instead of just immersing yourself in the culture from home.

There's an ongoing increase of strange or inaccurate translations, and the use of AI is being pushed heavily. I primarily use it for review of Japanese (I've been learning from various sources for years), but I feel uneasy using it for Spanish, because I won't be able to detect those errors because I'm still a beginner in that language. Previously, I felt like Duolingo was a good way to start learning, but now I think using a well made Anki deck combined with a textbook would be the way to go.

I used to love Dualingo until i was on a 150+ day streak and purchased a freeze and they didnt honor it. Now I'm back to 1 day. No way to contact them to correct it. edit: a new glitch: now occasionally, when I'm choosing words out of the word bank, they get locked up at the bottom of the page and don't register in my answer. there's no way to go back and correct it without losing a heart. This is a serious error and needs attention ASAP!

The app is great for learning languages, and it drills the words in your brain. Although it is annoying to run out of hearts, the app is extremely helpful. You can choose between beginner and intermediate levels, which is great, and the leaderboard motivates you to do more. Also, Duolingo does not have any ads unless you choose one to get a heart. This helps you focus better on the language you are learning. It allows you to reveiw skills in case you forgot and that alone is very helpful.

My opinion of the app has been dropping a lot lately. Removing the sentence discussions has been a huge loss. I made heavy use of those to understand mistakes or sentences I didn't quite get. Now, many mistakes leave you confused and with no explanation or way to figure out what you did wrong. Overall, Duolingo is not a bad app for supplementing language learning. However, it falters as a primary source and it seems to be getting worse and not better.

Duolingo has improved a bit over the years, but making me watch an ad for their paid tier, Super, between EVERY EXERCISE is incredibly excessive. It doesn't make me want to upgrade, it makes me want to switch to another app. If they don't stop, or at least reduce the frequency, of these ads, I'll be switching to another platform soon.

Ever since replacing the employees with AI, my streak freezes have been disappearing. I have on occasion been unable to complete my lessons earlier in the day but I usually do at least one before midnight. For whatever reason, though, the app is convinced I'm not doing them and keeps using up my streak freezes. I reiterate that my streak does not have to be frozen. These things are expensive at 200 gems each, too.

Do not purchase gems. It's offered for streak repair. The app glitches, and there's no one to contact for a refund. Sent emails with screenshots, and it only says message received. Weeks later, there is still no follow-up or refund. Don't waste your money. Just being honest to save you frustration. Other than in-app purchases, it's a decent learning app.

the AI sucks and ever since the most recent update, half of the audio doesn't work. you can't even report an error. the app literally said i had -1 hearts because none of the audio worked for one of the matching sections. i would tap a word to hear and... silence! just lost a heart each time i pressed the audio buttons. very cool. üëçüèª drops and speakly are preferable to this app.

I can tell this is AI, dissapointing. It can lack context and explanation, I have to look up why I got something wrong. Some words are super repetitive while other words don't show up often enough. It brings up the Spanish word for apples multiple times almost every single session; I see an opportunity for variety here. I do like that it makes it a game and more accessable. I would rather pay more for a higher quality product made by humans.

This gamefied way to try and learn language is what you pay for it. Spend thousands of dollars, and you might get up to the basic traveler level of the language. Do the basic free, and you really won't learn much. I also wonder what they are teaching and excuse the AI Slop, but there has been a mix of formal and casual. Which compared to other language programs, I have studied, says, is a no good way. My final frustration is the game. They change the scoring criteria monthly, so it's a money pit

This app seems determined to turn off learners - from weird grammar and syntax, poor Ai interaction, to this new and unstable energy based system, it's one one bad decision after another. It's no longer fun or functional for learning. I am grateful it got me comfortable with the basics of Chinese and helped me get back into Spanish again. But clearly it's time to move on to other programs and sign up for a language courses that is a much better use of my time and money.

The app has become extremely buggy. I constantly have to close and reopen it to update my progress after finishing a lesson. Sometimes, it will erase two or three full levels of progress. Last night, I needed to pass a test to be permitted to return to where I belonged. It will also say I have 3x XP for 30 minutes, which somehow turns out to be 1.5 XP for 10 minutes. I've submitted multiple bug reports without any reply or, worse, any signs of a fix.

I used to love this app. I've been using it for over a year, but they've disabled "practice to earn more hearts" in the free version. I thought it was a random bug, but it's happened to a couple of my friends with long streaks too. I think it's their way of getting people to do the paid version. We've all sent in bug reports but havent received any responses and theres nothing on the website. It's been a couple months. Without that feature, it's almost impossible to do multiple lessons in a day

Edit: This app gets worse and worse with every update. Now you can no longer practice?! And the practice available on paid version is different from free and awful. Original: I got it to refresh me after losing much of the Spanish I used to know. It's nice for that, too easy in some ways, for me, but that would be good for actual beginners! If I was really learning the language, I'd want some explanation of the types of phrase constructions that don't match English. Five stars!

No accented Polish letters to choose from on the phone app! I'm constantly told I have errors, when it's the app's fault for not giving me the correct Polish alphabet options! They provide those letters on a computer, yet you get more XP on the phone. Also, lessons are limited! I already reached the end after only 3 sections, and now am just given daily review lessons. No new content! They are not consistent with vocabulary - always switching "go" and "walk." Very confusing.

Not so slowly starting to make the free version unusable. 5 hearts, no way to get them back, with bugs in the ai powered lessons that fail you before you even get a chance to try. || The game-ification sounds good at first but it's predatory in nature and designed to get you to spend gems. Not to mention it's easy to lose yourself in the 'game' and forget to actually learn as opposed to just racking up xp to top leaderboards or slam out as many lessons as possible to get more xp during boost.

I used to love this app but they've made it nearly unusable. It's just constantly trying to get you to buy and use things for points, freezes, etc. You can't just use the app without being forced to participate in tedious annoying stuff that derails your learning. I paid for a subscription for years and finally canceled it because it's gotten so unpleasant to use. Edit: Took off another star, they somehow managed to make it even worse while doing absolutely nothing to make the courses better.

It's nice for encouragement and practice. But not learning properly. It doesn't state what is formal or not. I want to like it because of the easy interface. Update: Now practicing for hearts isn't working. I can only do it when prompted and not just practice for hearts until I have 5 again. The commercials say that this is to help to support people, but I'm under poverty level and can't afford this. So, who's being supported to "learn free"? Update: uninstalling because of AI bs.

Ive been studying Japanese for two years now and they aren't consistent. No two identical sentences are the same some times and that's frustrating when you arent paying for their "premium plan". They move the end of units further and further every time you finish a lesson and you think the unit is over. They ding you on the smallest mistyping. It just makes learning all the more frustrating. Update: What the hell is up with the icon?!?!?! It's disgusting to look at!!!!!!!!

When I first started, I loved this. I would have given it 5 stars and I was strongly considering buying the super version. Then about 2 months ago I could only earn 1 heart. Tonight I can earn more hearts, but no practice at all, only through ads. This is ridiculous and makes me want to quit the entire app. I am learning Korean and it's hard, I go through hearts like nothing, this used to be a great option for people who are tight on funds, but the changes are ridiculous.

I wish I could give zero stars. Duo was actually a great app when it started. Now, the best features are gone. Be very careful. Their free trial is extremely predatory. The page will force you to accept a "gift" of "free days," but that will activate the free trial. Once the surprise free trial is over, it will auto-sign you up for the entire year, the most expensive option, without your approval. I was charged over $100 and they will not refund. Same thing happened to 3 family members.

too much repetition of some easy things, then" you learned 25 new words today." not enough explanation for how to construct sentences and tenses, just a lot of guessing. I've been doing this for 250 days and it goes back to review simple words, but I feel like I'm missing so much understanding. I like the game format, but even bought a book to try and understand more. when my year's up I'll try something else I think.

Payed version ‚âà $100 per year. if you want to use the interactive video chat I.E. actually practicing speaking the language then that's an extra charge. The app fails at teaching grammar. You're just supposed to pick it up from the lessons but, Italian, for example, has 7 different versions of the definite article"the." Some explanation would be appropriate. typing out foreign phrases with your thumbs on your phone keyboard is torture. need to be able to convert typing exercises to speaking.

The ads for Super are too much. It's cool that Super helps bring free learning to people if you buy it, but as one of those people who can only afford the free version of Duolingo right now, the number of times that I have to sit through the Super advertisements is not worth it and it makes me want to stop using the app. I feel like I'm being punished for not subscribing to it. Every single lesson I get a normal ad and then an ad for Super. I would give the app zero stars right now if I could.

Just finished my free trial, and have came to the conclusion that Super is just too expensive for what you get out of this service, as well as they don't provide more than 3 pricing options. I was heavily invested in Duolingo up until this point, basically feeling required to pay in order to proceed is not how I want my learning experience to ultimately be. Back to the books I guess!

Purchased an annual subscription for this and regretting. New higher tier subscription came out since and I'm constantly nagged to updated. The whole trophy system is just silly and greatly flawed. Lessons don't scale in difficulty linearly. It goes from 0-60 quite quickly. Duolingo definitely helped at first, but I didn't need the premium version to get there, and now it's lessons are just too difficult and there is no bridge. I'll definitely be switching to another app to continue learning.

There are some serious holes in the learning. The voice speaks quickly in the other language and there are no pronunciation guides to show you how letters, groups of letters, or words are pronounced so have no real idea if you're pronouncing anything correctly. After not missing a day, mostly twice a day, for 4.7 years, I still have no ability to hold even a basic conversation. Also, if you force stop the app, it will just turn itself back on, which is really bad.

I've found this app to be ok for building and practicing vocabulary, but it doesn't actually help you *learn* a language. There is a difference between learning and rote memorization. Also they're "AI first" now and in order to do that they're laying off a bunch of employees so I no longer have any respect for this company. Once my yearly membership expires I won't be renewing.

Fun, gamified language learning, but I would say it's a great "starter" app for learning a new language, not if you want to develop deep understanding or expertise in a new language. It's good for learning vocabulary. After talking with several of my Spanish speaking friends, it's not always accurate, and the example phrases are sometimes bizarre, but I get why they do the silly phrases. Overall, it's been a fantastic family learning tool for my wife and kids.

For a while, Duolingo was doing okay with how it ran things. I know many apps use many ads, like this one. But now the way it is now is even worse because you are unable to practice to obtain multiple hearts now; only 1. This isn't helpful if you want to progress in the lessons. If I'm struggling in a lesson and only have 1 heart and fail, now I have to practice again on something that doesn't have to do with the lesson. It's unfortunate to see this app getting worse as the months go by.

Incessant advertisements. Free version has gotten rid of practicing to earn hearts. They take longer to regenerate now as well, and even when I complete goals, the XP boosts only work occasionally. They glitch all the time and I lose a lot of XP that way. I used to love duolingo. Now it just feels less about making learning accessible, more about being a money grab. Also, there is pretty obvious AI garbage now in a lot of lessons.

I still use the app, but getting rid of the "practice to earn hearts" feature has really decreased my motivation. That was a great way to stay active and engaged, as well as practice your skills. You already earn less XP for doing the practice. Please bring this feature back. The ads are expected for a free version, but changing this practice feature really kills it for me and for my children who are just starting their language learning.

title: Insight Timer - Meditation App
description:
* Apps of the Year Winner - TIME magazine and Women's Health *
* Happiest App in the World - Tristan Harris *

The number 1 free meditation app. Guided meditations, sleep music tracks and talks led by the top meditation and mindfulness experts, neuroscientists, psychologists and teachers from Stanford, Harvard, the University of Oxford and more. Music tracks from world-renowned artists. Join millions learning to meditate on Insight Timer to help calm the mind, reduce anxiety, manage stress, and sleep deeply.

With 100+ new free guided meditations and sleep tracks added daily, more meditation is practiced on Insight Timer than anywhere else. Great for both beginners and experienced practitioners.

FREE FEATURES:

* 100,000+  guided meditations
* Select by time for short meditations when on the go, helping you to build a simple daily habit
* Thousands of music tracks and ambient sounds to calm the mind, focus, sleep better and relax
* Customizable meditation Timer
* Follow your favourite teachers
* Thousands of discussion groups
* Stats and milestones for tracking your progress

SLEEP FOR INSIGHT TIMER

Struggling with insomnia? Can't get a restful night's sleep? Want to learn how to sleep better? Insight timer offers thousands of free music tracks, meditations, and stories to help you get a better night's sleep. Create the best environment for sleep and rest through meditation, there's something for everyone.

Sleep for insight timer features:
* Sleep Music
* Soundscapes
* Bedtime tales
* Sleep Meditations
* Sleep mode for all music

Sleep for insight timer also offers meditation courses for sleep. Improve your relationship with rest and sleep through the night with a number of courses that teach you how to: Sleep effortlessly, overcoming insomnia, Redefining approach to sleep, sleep with meditation, and much more.

Browse popular topics including:
* Sleep deeply 
* Dealing with Anxiety and Reducing Stress
* Getting through Recovery and Addictions
* Self-love and Compassion
* Focus and Concentration
* Leadership 
* Better Relationships
* Loving-Kindness

Join 11, 000+ leading meditation teachers, musicians and sleep experts.

Practice the following meditation types:
* Secular Mindfulness
* Yoga Nidra
* Mindful Sleep
* Buddhist Mindfulness
* Zen
* Insight Meditation
* Vipassana
* MBSR
* Walking Meditation
* Breathing Meditation
* Kundalini Yoga
* Metta
* Advaita Vedanta
* And many more..

Join groups for:
* Beginners Meditation
* Sleep Meditation
* Poetry
* Atheism
* Christianity
* Hinduism
* Transcendental Meditation
* And many more..

PAID FEATURE - INSIGHT PREMIUM MEDITATION

We have one optional in-app subscription.

* 1,000+ Courses - Help you sleep better, feel happier, and less stressed
* Listen offline (Listen to meditation and sleep music offline)
* Advanced Player (Repeat, Fast forward and Rewind, Pick-up where you left off)
* High-Quality audio

summary: Everyday Wellbeing for Sleep, Anxiety and Stress

scraped_reviews.content: 3.5 stars. GREAT track library, but app is SUPER busy: too many sections to check. It's cluttered & difficult to find what you want to use regularly. There should be more redundancy, a streamlined interface, so you can find meds more easily. They claim 1000s of tracks, but I feel bottlenecked when searching and having to scroll thru 1000s of tracks ONE. AT. A. TIME. What am I missing out on bc I didn't want to scroll for hours to find some great deep cuts? 5 star library, 2-star functionality.

I mostly use this app for the intention widget. It's a quick daily practice that I'm reminded of throughout the day, and just opening the app every day to keep my streak makes me more likely to actually meditate as well. Their library is huge, even with the free version. My only complaint is that when there are challenges (a week + of daily meditations around a theme) the notification displays on my widget and I don't know any way to clear it other than joining, which I don't always want to do.

I love this app! The meditations, talks and music are incredible but what I've been using the most lately is the timer. I set it for 15 minutes and the bells to go off on the minute. This brings my focus back (from my to do list or shopping list lol) and the tone holds me there in that amazing holy instant that so enhances my meditation time. Then I have a different bell at the end so I know when I've reached my 15 minutes without having to count or look at the screen. Definitely 5 stars!

The app is great, covers a lot of different aspects of self healing including meditation, courses and journaling. I like the daily intention widget. I like that there is someone for everyone, a variety of voices, techniques, etc. Some sections have spelling corrections and some do not which I find a little aggravating - but that is my only complaint.

To their credit, they have removed the spammy aggressive notifs that had no opt-out. But they seem to have just changed them to being in-app instead! Now I have to navigate through a bunch of annoying popups asking me to commit to this and that, do I want this track to play automatically next time or something--every second I'm forced to engage with this junk I can't even close without agreeing to it is a second I think about switching apps. Please! Insight was so good! You don't need this junk!

After 10 years, I'm done. 2 pop up ads before using a meditation timer is unacceptable. This used to be a simple timer with a calm bell that tracks your stats. Unfortunately, it is no longer simple. Over time they've been pushing new features (ie distractions) onto a perfect timer, which are exactly that: distractions. Please get rid of the pop ups about streaks, pro memberships, etc. A meditation timer should not try to extract DAU's and money out of you. I hope you find your roots again.

I use this app nearly every day, and paid for the in-app purchase. I'm generally very pleased, but I'm downgrading to 3 stars for some behavior that has been frustrating.  I set the timer for an hour, and then cease meditation after 5-20 minutes. I wish there was a count up option, but this was fine since it still logged it. I've seen it said that this would be changed, but 1 star off for it combined with the below...  When I do this, it appears that sometimes the log isn't transmitted to the server until some time later (this may be because I close and swipe from the drawer pretty quickly) but my consecutive days keeps getting reset to 1 if I meditate near midnight and this happens, since it's recorded as if I meditated past midnight. This ruins the gamification aspect of the app, which is a huge part of it. If there was an API to easily download the CSV I'd just do my own processing and start a day at four of five in the morning (which would capture the spirit of consecutive days for me better anyway) but I have to manually log in to grave the data, so that doesn't work either.  Update: the CSV they provide rounds down in minutes, ick. Better than Clock, but switching apps now.

This free app has a wide variety of meditations, talks, and courses. In order to access the courses, you need to pay for a subscription which costs about $5/ month. I have had many wonderful experiences with this app and have learned a lot from the instructors. The high quality of content and breadth and depth of material continually affords me moments of joy and inspiration. It is a surprising vector for change and vehicle for transformation.

Wow! I'm so impressed with all of the tools that are provided on the Insight Timer app, and it's free (unless you choose to pay for additional features). I've tried many "meditation" apps out there, and this is the best one I've found and thank goodness I did because I truly need to find inner peace and calmness, and this is giving me hope that I will find that here as long as I make it a consistent practice. There are meditations, sleep sounds, and a vast array of metaphysical guidance.

This is definitely the best app for meditation and sleep. And it's free! You can pay for the Plus membership, but there are literally thousands of offerings for free. No other app does that! And the teachers are amazing. I use Insight Timer everyday. I love the guided meditation, music, breathwork, yoga nidra, ambient sounds, etc. Something for everyone!

I have used this app for many many many years. I love it. HOWEVER recently these prompts that you force me to engage with and there being no way to skip or get back to the home screen without doing it or force closing the app is getting under my skin. I get that is a cool feature, but I don't want to be forced to use it man. just put a skip on every screen. I don't need another journal. I'm here to meditate. please.

A fantastic resource for mindfulness, meditation, daily reflection and journaling. Even better you can access a bunch of the content for free! You can bookmark your favorite meditations, follow your favorite teachers, create and name folders to organize content you've saved, write journal entries and more....ALL for FREE! The best app I've found for providing free, accessible content. If you can afford to support the app, content creators and teachers the Plus version has even more to offer!

This has been my go to app for a meditation timer for years. But it is harder to justify using with the constant dialogs, questions, social features, etc. I don't want to track my meditation duolingo style. I just want to use the timer with a bell sound. I am sure the other features are great, but if you just want a timer. This app is missing the mark.

Quit after tiring of the controlling prompts. I started using this app years ago, but the busy ness, unavoidable 'prompts' and required nudges are cult-like. For example, I turned off all notification & encouragement settings but it still 'requires' a YES choice to 3, 5, 10 sessions before allowing you to move forward. So you must 'lie' to the app if you don't use it daily. I'm experienced and don't use it as my daily app. That's not allowed here. The sea of prompts and busy UI no longer nurture

With every update, it gets harder and harder to stay in love with this app. This is what I use to fall asleep. Once, I could easily and quickly bring up the next track, which is critical when I'm on the verge of falling asleep. Suddenly insight timer is making me play twenty questions in order to continue. I wish it was something that I could disable. I understand this app is also used for actual meditation and these games might be helpful but I just want to sleep.

This is exactly what I needed. The free content is not limiting you from achieving the apps intention. The plus membership is nice, and I did participate in a trial, but I needed to see what the free content was about. The app doesn't force you or constantly throws ads or suggestions of a membership. The selection of teachers and filters makes this app amazing. This was the first meditation app on my list to try, and now I dont feel like trying anything else. Thank you!!!

So I really like this app, I want to give it 5 stars but.... 1. It won't play anything all the way through. It just stops playing mid way through the selection. Sometimes I fall asleep and don't realize it fully till I see the app in the morning, and sometimes it stops playing before I'm asleep. That's not helpful at all. 2. I look for the longest running sound tracks. Ie: over 90 minutes. The current filter only searches over 60 minutes. There's a lot to sift through to find the longer tracks.

This app literally pulls me out of the darkest hours of my life. What i really enjoy is that you dont have to pay for plus to really get the benefits. The paid version definitely has more in-depth structured courses for deep diving into inner work, but they also have shorter free courses that introduce wonderful concepts and give you enough to work with. There‚Äôs also live yoga classes pretty much 24/7, and that' with the free version. Basically, this app is really trying to actually help people.

I love this app! I actually pay for a membership which is crazy because I'm extremely cheap. My only issue is that it's getting a little cluttered in terms of features/prompts. I think the ideal number of prompts to be presented with after a meditation is 0 to 1. That said, please never get rid of the 8-hour nature soundscapes. They have improved my sleep so much.

I would like to give a better review and more stars, but now when you open up the app, you are being harassed by a multitude of questions. I just want to open the app up and listen to mellow music to sleep, not constantly being harassed. After several years of using this app, which I used to like, I think I'm going to delete it and find something else. A different app that doesn't continuously ask me the same questions after answering them. You've destroyed a good app, why?

July 2025 thinking about finding another, more simple app.. Too many pop-ups that can't be disabled. Too many menus to find the features I've used for 9 years! Subscription is expensive & according to most reviews not worth it anymore, so I won't re-subscribe. Nov. 2021 Love this app, it got me into regular meditation. Some of the live sessions have been transformative! Made some really beautiful connections through the groups feature too. Thank you for creating such a lovely community :)
scraped_reviews.replyContent: ‚ù§Ô∏è ‚ù§Ô∏è ‚ù§Ô∏è

scraped_reviews.content: I've used this app for over a decade, but it's now terrible because of the non-stop in-your-face exhortations to track every part of one's meditation experience and icky upselling popups. Rate the meditation! How do you feel? Oops, you missed a day - slap your hand and don't you dare do that again! Buy a pricey subscription now! Totally goes against a peaceful experience and is stressful. I've been using another, better app (Neo) that has one-time paid features and YouTube videos. Uninstalled.

been using since the pandemic, it just keeps getting more and more bloated. And it keeps asking for me to pay for more features or add this widget or add that alarm. I just want to meditate. now that I can't even use the simplest timer with a gong function without data connection, I'm saying goodbye. it was good back when it was free and simple. Now it is better for those that need guided meditations and life coaching.

I love this app - SO many different tracks to choose from in the free version, it's amazing. however, I can no longer find where to "SET AN INTENTION" for the day to show up in my widget. It looks like it was switched to a "goal" which I don't need - I already have many to do list apps and notepads for that. I just want to set an intention/reminder and see it on my widget on my home screen. Is there a way to get that back???

I absolutely love Insight Timer and always recommend it to anyone and everyone. There are so many different meditations, talks, and music tracks available that I could spend all day listening if I was able to. I always feel better after listening, no matter what I listen to. Thank you to everyone who provides us with their amazing, thoughtful, and loving gifts!

Just began using this. It's a little awkward when you don't reach your Daily Goal. You need to put this first -- if you're coming back UP.. this helps u schedule your time but in my case, other's days interfere w my goals.. starting slow is best n still hard for me to reach the simplest goals. If I started any slower, I'd still be in the same place. üòÇ

All I wanted was to download a free audio file & downloading from the website is no longer allowed. I don't have fast internet so streaming doesn't work. I don't appreciate being forced to install an app then being forced to do the trial of the paid version to download anything so I can listen to it properly offline. I never do trials of paid versions because it's mean to glimpse a luxury I will never own & cancelling is a nuisance. I don't have an income. No app is worth renting indefinitely.

This used to be a great app, but now they're heavily pushing user engagement with forcing you to click "I'm committed" after a meditation and several more selections before you can start another meditation, with no way to skip these steps. Is it just me, or shouldn't a meditation app allow me to be, ahem, MINDFUL of what I "commit" to?

It's a very good app for meditation and mindfulness -- lots of free things. I have recently encountered a problem -- whenever I try to play one of the sessions I've bookmarked, all I get is the endlessly spinning wheel. Why won't the app upload the sessions any more? I've tried different WiFi networks, but that doesn't make a difference.

I've been using Insight Timer for quite some time now, mainly just for the timer function. I have paid for their plus option and availed myself of a number of the courses they offer. The selection of teachers and courses, guided meditations and musical pieces, and just their simple but great timer make for an excellent meditation app.

This used to be the best meditation app but it has been completely ruined by retention based design. I never thought I'd see clickbait meditations. The constant surveys have gotten really far out of hand. There was a overhaul in the past year that ruined the app. It went from being really peaceful to being immediately stress inducing. Every inch is trying to get you to interact, stay, share, commit aka they want to retain and upsell. I'd happily pay for quality meditations but you gotta fix this

As part of my treatment and recovery program I've been tasked with learning to meditate and be more mindful in my everyday life. As part of that, I have come across Insight Timer and it is truly a game changer. I now have access to so much more content, teachers, and events than I ever dreamed existed!! I've now learned to set a daily intention and to journal all inside this app. I highly recommend it to anyone seeking great content and exceptional teachers.

I've had this app installed for a bajillion years but only these past few months begun truly taking advantage of all the tracks and the timer and everything. I joined in for the Mid Year Reset challenge and loved the connectedness of following the same guided meditations together with everyone. It's been very helpful to have a specific space to return to when I want to commit to a formal moment of meditation, and I've enjoyed the self-reflective "set intention" feature.

I want to give this app more stars because I really like it, but multiple times I've have guided meditations randomly crash or pause in the middle of playback. Now, anytime a speaker takes a pause, it adds anxiety and disrupts the meditation experience because I'm not sure if they're just pausing or if I need to check that the app is still running correctly

The subscription is over priced if you're just using is a few additional timer options. It would be nice to see a couple tiers of subscriptions so if you're not using teachers you can pay less to use the increased timer features. It's also very buggy and nearly crashes at the end of every season when you hit finish. Update: I cancelled my subscription, uninstalled Insight, and just made my own app because I got tired of the constant freezing and inability to add my own background songs/sounds.

The best I can find. The app is not user friendly and is poorly organized, but I love that it's free and it has a very wide selection of meditations to choose from based on your need - music (native flutes, singing bowls, guitar etc), nature sounds, guided, five minutes, three hours etc, I appreciate the app for what it is, but it could be improved in terms of usability.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for providing your valuable feedback. Please reach out to us at help@insight.co, if you have other suggestions.

scraped_reviews.content: Even though I only use the free version, it is still a wonderful aid to making meditation easier for me. EDIT: since Insight Timer's interface changed, I have had multiple issues with it, and it is very frustrating. As a meditation teacher, I recommended Insight Timer to my students as a great adjunct. I no longer do that, and intend to uninstall the program from my phone. Too bad, too, because at one time I really loved it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Anthony, we appreciate your feedback about the latest version of the app and we apologize for the inconvenience this may cause you. Can you please email us at help@insight.co so we could check further on the issues you have encountered? Looking forward to your response.

scraped_reviews.content: I really preferred the older design...the physical appearance was more appealing to me, and it was somewhat easier to navigate. I presume technical issues compelled the changes; looking forward to new, evolving editions; by far, it's still the best and most versatile app I've found for meditation, particularly with the choice of bells, the choice for the number of rings, and the choice for evenly-spaced or random intervals. Thanks, Christopher!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you Wally!

scraped_reviews.content: The selection of meditations is vast and selective, and the timer feature is the best I've seen from any meditation app. However, recently, every other time I play a meditation, it would stop in the middle. Usually, when I download a meditation it would play all the way through, but it would still occasionally stop due to an error. I'm using the paid version of the app, one shouldn't have to expect such poor service from something they're paying for.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Sorry to hear about the inconvenience. We would like to fix this. As we don't have your email address, can you please write to us at help@insighttimer.com so that we can assist you further. We look forward to your email.

scraped_reviews.content: I used to love this app but I've noticed for the last 6 months it's been terrible. It constantly glitches. It stops playing randomly or it'll randomly start playing even though the app isn't open or it'll even play non stop, and keep loop-playing far past when it should have stopped. I'm having to force close it all the time. They ruined this app. Thankfully I've only ever used the free version. I may have to uninstall and find a different app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Alison, we're truly sorry to hear about the technical issues you've been experiencing. Please try reinstalling the app to address these glitches. If the problem persists, please email us at help@insighttimer.com so we can assist you further. We're committed to improving your experience.

scraped_reviews.content: I've used this app for many years. I am dismayed, however, that they no longer have a way to contact them through the app. I want to make a suggestion that I think is sorely needed. The finish button is directly above the Go Button. When the phone is lying on the table it is really difficult to hit the Go Button and not hit the Finish button. If one has done an hour and a half of sitting and has an hour left to go having half of it canceled out is no small matter. Two commercial.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Susan, we value your long-term use of the app and appreciate your feedback. We apologize for any difficulty with the button placement. To contact support and share your suggestion, please go to the Menu and click on the Help tab within the app. If you have any further concerns, you can also reach us directly at help@insighttimer.com.

scraped_reviews.content: I've used this app for years, for the timer function alone. I enjoyed having the ambient sounds to listen to while I journaled, meditated, and / or did yoga. Every now and again, they would add some new sounds to pick from. But now you have to get a subscription that costs $10 a month just to have access to any new ambient sounds. That price is ridiculously high and may very well force me to use another app if it doesn‚Äôt change.

This used to be my favorite meditation app and I had rated it 5 stars, but they've made some changes recently that have made it much less useful. They're now pushing the paid membership for access to courses and have made it difficult to find a lot of the free content by removing (hiding?) the search functionality. Additionally, I think there is a lot of content that has disappeared lately, since I can't find many of the things I used to listen to. If they restore it, I'll give it 5 stars again.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Tony - Sorry you feel this way about the update. We have not removed any meditations. All 15,000 tracks are still available. Please email us at help@insight.co (not .com) for further assistance. Many thanks, Insight Support.

scraped_reviews.content: I've had the Plus version for a year. It was really great, I used the download feature to sort meditations to sleep to, ones for my kids to sleep to, another folder for spiritual talks when I'm traveling/driving, etc. I even did a few lives, including yoga. I've recommended it to many of my friends. Since the update, however, tracks won't play if it's in airplane mode. UPDATE: Supports been great but still doesn't work and I don't want to reboot and lose what I saved.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jennifer, we're sorry to hear about the issues with the download feature. For immediate assistance, please email us at help@insighttimer.com, and we'll help ensure your downloaded tracks play as intended. Your restful sleep is a priority for us.

scraped_reviews.content: Used to be a great app but the ads are now everywhere and you can't escape. Searching now hides free content below all the paid stuff. Also lost all of my journals, so much for my years of journaling my progress. Those used to be a great resource, now it's been taken over with constant pushes to buy premium on every screen, which destroys the relaxation point entirely. I'd be ok throwing a few dollars for a paid version but making it a subscription is too much especially at $60/year.

This app used to be great but since they have become more commercial, always trying to sell me a course or some paid content, it's loaded with bugs The keyboard doesn't work properly, I can't see spelling corrections nor emojis (and that's an inconsistent bug). Also, it doesn't always allow me to see who I have meditated with. Please keep it simpler IT, that's why I come here.

This app allows exploration and sharing on so many levels. I agree with other comments that there is more marketing toward purchasing subscriptions that interrupts sessions. I understand the need to make money, but I also hope the developers consider the times we're in and the health service they are providing; that allowing access with the -opportunity- to upgrade rather than forcing subscription will make for a more inclusive path to healing. Overall, amazing content, amazing contributors, consistency in versioning is spot on.

Loosing ground with me, a looong time member. 2.5 stress. Frequently cannot get meditations to play. They que when selected to play and immediately stop . . . "media failed to play." Tech support ain't what it used to be. They want me to unplug my modem, restart my pc. What? Last, this is third and final attempt at uninstalling and reinstalling. If this doesn't resolve the issue going forward, I may be done. Will not perpetuate stress with an app designed to alleviate and lessen stress.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there - We're deeply sorry to hear this. It appears you are using an older version of the app. Please update to the latest version for an improved experience with a number of bug fixes. If you experience further issues, kindly reach out to our Support Team at help@insight.co (not .com) With much gratitude.

scraped_reviews.content: I'm reducing stars. Been enjoying the app + premium subscription for years. It's been a valuable primary resource for my meditation practice. However, lately the playbacks will randomly stop partway. I couldn't find a solution in the support section, so I cleared cache, cleared data, and reinstalled. All my bookmarks, playlists, and list of followed teachers are gone üòî I probably shouldn't have cleared the data. Don't know yet if the original issue is resolved - TBD.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear about your experience. Please reach out to us at help@insighttimer.com so we can assist you in logging back into your original account and addressing the playback issue. We're here to help resolve any issues you may encounter.

scraped_reviews.content: It was good at first, over a year ago. Then subsequent updates kept changing the layout so you had to keep refiguring out how to get what you want. But there were times i couldn't even find the accounts i followed. Then they started making the live events harder to find. I just stopped using it. Event quality was sometimes meh as well, a bit superficial.

scraped_reviews.content: The worst service ever. They charged every month but couldn't watch any single contents. Reached out to their customer service multiple times but not a single time I received any response and the issue stayed unresolved. Tried to Unsubscribe from the Zee5 website, doesn't change the plan even after clicking Cancel Plan. I want to remove my credit card from the account, it doesn't even have that option. At this point, this can easily be called scam.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Please share the issues/difficulties you‚Äôre facing on Z5 by writing to us at https://www.zee5.com/help, so we can assist you further. We are always looking to help our viewers.

scraped_reviews.content: I wanted to report a recurring issue with the video player. Often, after fast-forwarding a few times, the video freezes and won't stop loading. This has been happening for a while, and I'm still encountering it after the most recent update. Having to close and reopen the video is pretty frustrating. Could you please look into a fix? Thanks!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are truly sorry you had a bad experience with us. We assure you; we‚Äôll do everything we can to turn it around. In the meanwhile, if you‚Äôre facing any issues, please feel free to visit our Help Center at www.zee5.com/help

scraped_reviews.content: Trash can't even buy a premium subscription. Also, some of the movies don't even play they just buffer and keep getting the same error over and over. "Something went wrong pleasetry again after some time." I contact support, and they are no help they keep writing back same text. Please clear cache and data and reinstall the app. This issue isn't just on the app it's also on all the platforms. Then, I can't even cancel the subscription. I keep getting error messages.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! We regret that you are not having a delightful experience on our platform. We would like to support you in the issues you are facing and address all your concerns regarding our app. Please write to us at https://www.zee5.com/help/ and we will assist you further.

scraped_reviews.content: Zee5, this app has issues with the subtitles. Sometimes, they refuse to come on when watching on my firetv and android phone. title: Mapy.com: Offline hiking maps
description:
Plan your next outdoor adventure with Mapy.com: maps, route planner, navigation and tracker for your activities. Find your way in mountains or deep forests - we have your back. No signal? Doesn't matter, download map and try Mapy.com offline.

Offline maps of the whole world

- Outdoor maps
- Traffic maps
- Winter maps
- Aerial maps
- Additional offline features: route planning, search, navigation

Traveling to places without signal? Download an offline map so you don‚Äôt have to worry about being in the mountains, deep in the forest, or outside the EU without internet. Route planning and navigation work fully even in offline mode, and you'll reach your destination without signal.

Route planner

- For different types of transport
- Point A to point B or round trips
- Estimated time, route distance, elevation gain
- Adding waypoints

Plan your route exactly to your needs‚Äîwhether you're driving, cycling, skiing, or hiking. Each mode offers specific options: avoid tolls and highways when driving, customize routes based on your bike type, or choose the shortest or tourist hiking path when walking, including those with via ferratas.

GPS navigation for cars, hiking, and cycling

- Road closures and shortcuts
- Voice-guided navigation
- Precise addresses and GPS coordinates
- Turn-by-turn directions
- Location sharing with family and friends

Navigate to your destination even in the most remote corners of the world‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre on a trip or heading to a client. We‚Äôll find your destination using either precise addresses or GPS coordinates, and guide you with detailed voice instructions. Share your real-time location with your loved ones, so they always know where you are.

Tracker for all your activities

- Performance recording
- Total distance, average and max pace
- Saving and sharing with others

Track your performance with the Tracker. You‚Äôll see total activity time, speed insights, and elevation gain‚Äîwhether you're walking with a stroller, on a gravel bike, or via ferrata.

My Maps

- Save POIs, routes, and tracked activities
- Sync across all your devices
- Organize into folders
- Set your home and work address
- All your ratings and photos in one place

Create your personal journey with Mapy.com. Your travel dreams, completed routes, rated locations, and photos‚Äîall in one place. View and share from your phone or PC.

Mapy.com Premium

- Set your own speed
- More routing options
- Offline maps of the whole world
- Wear OS support
- Notes for saved routes and activities

Plan your route your way: choose from a wider range of options in the planner, set your own walking or driving speed, and download unlimited offline maps. New: Mapy.com now available for Wear OS devices.

Wear OS

- Mapy.com now also on smartwatches for premium users
- Maps, Tracker, and Navigation on Wear OS
- Add tiles to your Wear OS device

TIPS AND RECOMMENDATIONS:

- You need an internet connection to download offline maps
- Enable location services in your phone‚Äôs settings for proper functionality
- The app requires background location access to share your location
- For questions or quick help, use the form in the app settings
- Using GPS in the background may reduce battery life
- Join our user community at https://www.facebook.com/mapycom: share your experiences, follow updates, or suggest new features

Track your performance with the Tracker. You‚Äôll see total activity time, speed insights, and elevation gain‚Äîwhether you're walking with a stroller, on a gravel bike, or via ferrata.

My Maps

- Save POIs, routes, and tracked activities
- Sync across all your devices
- Organize into folders
- Set your home and work address
- All your ratings and photos in one place

Create your personal journey with Mapy.com. Your travel dreams, completed routes, rated locations, and photos‚Äîall in one place. View and share from your phone or PC.

Mapy.com Premium

- Set your own speed
- More routing options
- Offline maps of the whole world
- Wear OS support
- Notes for saved routes and activities

Plan your route your way: choose from a wider range of options in the planner, set your own walking or driving speed, and download unlimited offline maps. New: Mapy.com now available for Wear OS devices.

Wear OS

- Mapy.com now also on smartwatches for premium users
- Maps, Tracker, and Navigation on Wear OS
- Add tiles to your Wear OS device

TIPS AND RECOMMENDATIONS:

- You need an internet connection to download offline maps
- Enable location services in your phone‚Äôs settings for proper functionality
- The app requires background location access to share your location
- For questions or quick help, use the form in the app settings
- Using GPS in the background may reduce battery life
- Join our user community at https://www.facebook.com/mapycom: share your experiences, follow updates, or suggest new features
summary: Walking route planner, gps navigation & distance tracker for outdoor adventures

scraped_reviews.content: EDIT: I stand corrected. See dev response. Since the "about this app" is purposely made unclear, here's how offline maps work for the free vs paid tiers: Free tiers - you get one map of one whole country. The size of the United States map at time of writing is just over 33gb. Once downloaded it will regularly update. Paid tiers - you get more downloads and aren't forced to download entire countries. I think it's very scummy that the app does make this clear as day in the store page.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your detailed insights on the offline maps. Your feedback about clarity is valuable, and we strive to ensure users have a great experience. Wishing you enjoyable trips ahead.

scraped_reviews.content: Pretty good app for route navigation! For some reason, when mobile data enabled, map tracking stop working but when data connection is disabled and only gps used, the tracker works. Beside that, everything is ok! Free version has enough features for basic map navigation such as route planning, tracking and saving the points on the map. I only use it for hiking, but the app has options for cycling, auto, skiing and some other uses. Y can choose map layers such as aerial map, basic or winter maps.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, please try to reinstall the app. If problem still exist, please report it and describe it in detail directly through the app so we have access to diagnostic data: https://mapy.com/?feedback=menu ‚Äì choose the appropriate option based on the issue. Our team will do their best to help. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: Used to be amazing, but doesn't work since it was updated Dec. 2024. It has the best info on trails and infrastructure in many countries to navigate. But since the update, it's completely unusable. On wifi, I can't see get any maps to load, I need to create an account to get access to 1 offline map without paying for premium-a hefy $20/year-but the acct creation process doesn't work. And the 1 map limit is crazy, trails cross borders! So disappointed with the update. Need to find a new option.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! The app allows registration using trusted accounts like Google, Microsoft, or Apple, so you can access offline map and your saved trails on all devices. Many core features remain free, including the ability to download and swap one offline map at any time. Your input helps us improve‚Äîthank you for sharing your thoughts!

scraped_reviews.content: I don't use mapy.cz for driving very much, but for hiking or other outdoor activity it is by far the best map app I've ever used. And I've tried multiple. Downloading offline maps is very easy and setting up routes and navigation is intuitive. It's a Czech app but has trails for any country in the world. Have used it in Scotland, Armenia, USA, Bulgaria and Switzerland and everywhere it's very useful

A really great mapping app, best I've found. However, the integration with Seznam is quite bad. They make you register (for saving paths) even though nobody wants their account. They try to get your information, e.g. phone number, year of birth. The reset password mechanism is broken. Opening a second account with the same number is broken. All in all, a world class app integrated with a bad provider.

Good and it's free! I will give 5 stars if have all the gravel bike trails, bike lanes, and more options of how to custom bike routes such as easy ride and avoid busy traffic roads. Plus need to have more options of choosing different types of bicycle such as gravel, touring, etc. It will be really nice and to use when planning routes just be able to draw right on the road not Markers. Please add this features in future updates thank you! Kudos to the developers, you are awesome! Thank you!üëçüèº

what is wrong with the offline maps download????? it works only when the screen is on. so I can "never" download the maps unless I spend dozen of minutes clicking on the screen to keep it on. this is ridiculous. why it doesn't download in the background??? (wife connected) also, the download speed is super slow. upgrade the servers guys
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback ‚Äî and sorry for the frustration. That definitely shouldn‚Äôt be the case. Could you please check if you have any battery saver or power optimization settings turned on for Mapy? Some systems may pause downloads when the screen is off to save battery.

scraped_reviews.content: I wanted to like it but after having it on my phone for several weeks, I've tried to sign up for an account a few times using my personal email and every time it fails. Either I don't get a verification code by email, or after waiting a long time I do get the vode, but when I enter it I get an error.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! The app allows registration using trusted accounts like Google, Microsoft, or Apple. We're sorry if this process caused concerns and appreciate your understanding. If you need help,. write us: https://mapy.com/?feedback=menu You can also visit our help page: https://help.mapy.com/login/

scraped_reviews.content: in last months it is lagging almost all the time the app is always crashing when clicked on "share route", sometimes crashing even during creation of a route and what is worst when it was free these things never happened, it was best navigation app on the market, now its not working sufficiently any more
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Good morning. Thank you for your review, sir. We are very sorry the app is lagging and crashing when sharing or creating routes. Please try uninstalling and reinstalling the app. If the problem persists, contact support with details at https://mapy.com/?feedback=menu and we will be happy to help.

scraped_reviews.content: The best OpenStreetMaps viewer. I use it mainly for hiking and biking. In car, it could be better representing the lanes or faster recalculating your route. And for exploring the city, Google Maps is still better thanks to its infinite amount of user data related to photos and reviews of places. It would be awesome if it could show all this information too. Looking for many locations of one category can be a little bit sluggish. For example, looking for nearby toilets or drinking water spots.

Fantastic mapping app. Not just for the Czech Republic but works beyond its borders. Clear mapping, especially good for hiking paths and has useful navigation features. Also has a database of information such as bus times (click on a stop to see the timetable), facilities, etc. It's like Google maps but accurate and clearer. Has aerial imagery and street views. You can download offline maps - one country free then others paid - but the files are large. Just awesome!

Great alternative to google Maps. The navigation is great and accurate. Two problems: firstly, when showing the estimated time that the car journey will take the app doesn‚Äôt consider (or maybe it doesn‚Äôthave the data to) traffic, so sometimes the journey can be 20-50min longer than the app showed. The second problem is the lack of a "public transportation" option. besides that the app is great.

The maps don't show when the app is offline. The only thing that shows is the path on a white background. There's no option to download the maps. Edit: YOU NEED TO PAY to have offline maps which is something you learn later.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thank you for your feedback! I‚Äôm sorry for the inconvenience with the offline maps.
You can download the offline map of one country for free. If the map isn‚Äôt displaying correctly, please try turning off mobile data on your phone. If you have any further questions, feel free to contact us at https://mapy.com/?feedback=menu -we‚Äôll be happy to help.

scraped_reviews.content: I used to love Mappy.cz; it was the best in its category. But the new ‚Ç¨19/year subscription just to download maps is extremely disappointing. It's unfair, especially for occasional users. Apps like this should be a one-time purchase, not something you keep paying for. It feels like a greedy move to resell the same product every year. I‚Äôve now switched to OsmAnd+, which I bought outright, and it gives me far more control and freedom. I‚Äôm much happier with it and will no longer use Mapy.cz.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. We understand the change may be disappointing. Basic features like trip planning and offline map of one country remain free. The subscription helps us keep improving the app and maps.

scraped_reviews.content: Good: detailed map, allows to select toll options per country. Bad: traffic data seems to not update correctly or claims wrong there is a jam, inaccurate speed limits, saved points not visible on a map despite proper settings - you have to open folder in the menu andgo back to map.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Marcin Dziƒôgielewski, thank you for sharing your thoughts. I'm glad you pointed out the strengths and areas for improvement. Your feedback on traffic data and saved points visibility is important to us. Please reach out to our support team at https://mapy.com/?feedback=menu or visit our forum at https://community.mapy.com/ for more assistance.

scraped_reviews.content: The free version has some limits, but it works especially for hiking where you have numbers of the trails and more information on the path
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback üíö We‚Äôre glad the free version helps on your hikes with trail info. We‚Äôd love any suggestions to improve it ‚Äî share ideas or find tips on our forum: https://community.mapy.com/ If you enjoy it, please consider updating your rating to 5‚≠ê!

scraped_reviews.content: does a great job at route finding, for hiking and cycling, visualising typography and other details. my new favourite mapping app.

scraped_reviews.content: a great free and easy to use app that more people need to enjoy and share their knowledge on treks, plus you can download a map of a full county for free and this is very useful
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Good afternoon, thank you for your wonderful feedback! We're thrilled you find the app easy to use and appreciate the map download feature. We hope more users join in sharing their trekking experiences. Wishing you many exciting adventures ahead! üó∫Ô∏è

scraped_reviews.content: More languages? Hello, I wonder will you add more languages in nearest future? I would love Slovenian language (sloven≈°ƒçina) or at least Croat or Serbian. I have just downloaded your app, so I can not give proper feedback yet. Will do it later, after testing. Edit Hello again, there is none of mentioned languages. I am the most interested in my native language, Slovenian. As I said before, at least EU languages should be covered.

scraped_reviews.content: Maps clarity is phenomenal, super intuitive to use. Only thing I am missing is a bit more stats on a finished route instead of only time lengths and height. Also navigation with car is becoming valid!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! We're thrilled you find the maps clear and intuitive. üòä We appreciate your suggestion for more stats on completed routes - have you checked our help? https://help.mapy.com/route-planning/ Safe travels and happy exploring! üåç

scraped_reviews.content: Having only used the free version so far I must say I've been thoroughly impressed with what this app offers, especially considering the features available in the free version: Very nice UI and look of the map (especially when changing zoom level), very detailed and accurate markups of even the smallest hiking trails/paths around my local area (in Norway, more accurate than our local map-apps in fact - shout-out to tiny historical, local place-names in particular!), excellent GPS response time and accuracy. Haven't found anything better, and you get all this without paying, and no intrusive ads at all! Will definitely be joining premium shortly, I would if only to support the developers honestly, recommended!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for the kind words and detailed feedback! We're really happy to hear the app works well for you in Norway. Thanks for the support ‚Äî and if you decide to go Premium, we truly appreciate it! üòä

scraped_reviews.content: Up to the last update I was super happy with this app. Great markings for known hiking routes and a lot of points of interest all over. I used it a lot for offline navigation, but after upgrading it, the offline features have become accessible only for premium users...I cannot even free up my memory of maps that I don't need anymore (unless I uninstall the app). This is a pity and makes me move on to other apps for offline navigation.

This step allows us to continue developing the app and maintaining its quality. Most features remain free, and you can still download one offline map at no cost. Thank you for your understanding.

scraped_reviews.content: Used ot be good, now its rubbish. The app was not showing the same tracks as the map on PC.I was told to update the app...but it was the same after. HOWEVER, the new app now doesnt allow offline maps of multiple countries.What a trick!! And worse,your app uses the FREE openstreet map! Why do you charge premium to download something that is FREE? At the time I was on the mountain between italy and Switz, and could not see my trail over the border. What do I do then?? The dev company scuks 4ss.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Good afternoon, I'm really sorry to hear about your experience with the app. We understand the importance of offline maps when traveling. Thank you for your feedback!

scraped_reviews.content: Since the app is not free anymore, it is much worse. scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, if you encountered a technical issue while using the app, please report it and describe it in detail directly through the app so we have access to diagnostic data: https://mapy.com/?feedback=menu ‚Äì choose the appropriate option based on the issue. Our team will do their best to help. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: Super maps app. Well optimized for offline use. Paying one dinner worth of money per year is ok for what you are getting. Few ideas for improvements: * Using the app during longer jurneys leads to overheating (observed on various devices) * Downloads/updates don't resume and always start from scratch. * It will be nice if map update save data a bit and just download what it is new. (Downloading 7GB because someone opened new MacDonalds in Germany is "meh")
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thanks a lot for your feedback! We‚Äôre aware that long journeys can cause device heating and are working on performance improvements. Your suggestion to download only new map data has been passed to our development team. We really appreciate your input ‚Äì it helps us make the app better!

scraped_reviews.content: This is an excellent app and in some ways better than Google Maps! The only thing that's keeping me from being a paid subscriber is the fact that the satellite images cannot be zoomed in beyond a certain (shallow) point, and instead the app returns some text in (presumably) Czech that I don't understand. scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the kind words ‚Äî we really appreciate it! Could you please let us know what exactly the text says when you try to zoom in? scraped_reviews.content: The app is working for me now. 4 stars for not having its own reading engine in the app. It uses the phone's reading voice.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the update, and glad the app is working for you now! We appreciate the 4 stars and the feedback about the reading voice. We rely on your phone‚Äôs TTS engine for voice guidance to support many languages and voices, but we‚Äôll pass your suggestion to the team for future improvements.

scraped_reviews.content: The best app in its category. Great map response time, accurate and has a good interface. The next stage could be the ability to discover new hiking and MTB paths :)
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for your kind words! üôè We‚Äôre thrilled to hear you enjoy the map accuracy and interface. For discovering new hiking and MTB paths, you might want to try our trip planner‚Äîit‚Äôs perfect for finding and planning exciting routes. Happy exploring! üö¥‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èü•æ

scraped_reviews.content: great maps! I really like it. I compared it with so many other services - and these maps suit me the best: it works offline and online (without downloading) both; there are reviews and photos; etc Thx!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Good day! Thank you for your fantastic feedback. We‚Äôre thrilled to hear that our maps stand out for you, both offline and online, and that you appreciate the reviews and photos features. Enjoy your adventures with our app, and safe travels! üó∫Ô∏è

scraped_reviews.content: Perfect maps not only for Czech Republic. Navigation tends to optimize towards short route. not the one on the main roads.

scraped_reviews.content: Not competitive as a driving navigator. It issues wrong contradictory verbal instructions. It's way behind some free competition. Good hiking maps are not enough!

scraped_reviews.content: Very convenient and intuitive app! It has everything you need for simple hikes and walks. Easy to use and reliable.

scraped_reviews.content: My go to App when I'm deciding where to head of next. Not navigation mind you, but to get a feel of 'this area might be interesting'. This is a result of its map rendering, something which I love. Unfortunately somethings are now behind a (rather expensive IMO) subscription paywall. Rest of the app needs some work. I don't know about its routing and navigating capabilities because I don't use it for such. Not singling out Mapy as I don't trust Google either for routing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks a lot for sharing your thoughts! We‚Äôre glad to hear you enjoy exploring areas with our maps ‚Äî that‚Äôs exactly what we aim for.
